result.execSummary:
The defendant Collin C. CAMPION was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling/vocational training or a combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Counseling including AODA assessment per the agent's recommendation.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 5 only.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was terminated from probation effective 04-29-17.
Adding two additional counts of misdemeanor theft, contrary to Section 943.20(1)(a).

Authorization to Appear; Notice of Retainer, Entry of Plea, Jury Demand, Request for Pretrial & Discovery Demand; Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 03-04-15 at 10:00 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 02-16-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Forgery, on 10-03-14.
Initial appearance is set for 02-09-15 at 2:30 p.m.
